column4: how can I rename multiple files in a directory.   when I enter "mv -T *.mod *.mpg", I getmv: extra operand `mov006.mod'...I've tried multiple ways but am at a lost
how can I rename multiple files in a directory.   when I enter "mv -T *.mod *.mpg", I getmv: extra operand `mov006.mod'...I've tried multiple ways but am at a lost
use 'rename'.  Do you know regexp?
tried rename and looked up the man, but guess I'm not doing it right...I'll show you the error is a sec
k
how should I type it
use ' not
can you give me the full line?
but, that is a pretty useless command.  You will replace the .mod at the end of any files that end in .mpg
right you want s/\.mod$/.mpg/
typing rename s/\.mod$/.mpg  doesn't do anything...even tried rename 's/\.mod$/' .mpg but get Substitution replacement not terminated at (eval 1) line 1.    What am I doing wrong?
you forgot the / at the end
did it too, to no avail...aaarrrrggggghhhhh
paste the whole command you entered and the output on pastebin
I'll do it multiple ways and paste it...give me a couple mins
just do this one:  rename 's/\.mod$/.mpg/' *.mod
thank you very much
were you doing *.mpg at the end before?
ah ok
my video camera puts the .mod extension, but the files are really .mpg ... it was aggravating, so i appreciate your help
np
I'm out of here, but wanted to say thanks again
need your assistance again...just upgraded (from scratch) to Fiesty and lost my history...you helped me the other day with the rename...do you remember the syntax?
